thinking.disposable_income: Hyde Park has a mixed-income population with a median household income around $53,000. Large student population from University of Chicago affects the average. About 25% of residents live below poverty line while also having some affluent households
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Significant portion of residents are students and academics with moderate discretionary spending. Retail and entertainment spending concentrated around 53rd Street and University campus. Many residents balance education expenses with other needs
thinking.accessibility: Well-served by public transit with Metra Electric, CTA buses, and proximity to Green Line. High walkability score. Good bicycle infrastructure. Most destinations accessible within community. Large portion of residents commute to downtown/university. Lower car ownership than city average
thinking.decision_rationale:
1. Prioritize lower transit fares due to large student/academic population and high transit usage
2. Moderate tax rate acceptable given mixed income levels and strong public benefits
3. Support driving fees to fund transit and reduce congestion around campus
4. Balance travel time improvements with cost burden on residents
5. Selected proposals that maintain transit affordability while improving service quality
